definition: sentence-final particle similar to 了[le5], but carrying a tone of approval
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to strap tightly/to bind
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: The Japanese understand that. Why don’t we?
sentences.chinese: 小日本都懂，咱们咋就不懂嘞？

sentences.english: And, oh yeah, a certain magazine that features pictures of nude women.
sentences.chinese: 还有，是的，一本封面是裸体女嘞的。
我们的产品是白兰地叫“嘧嘞胺”。

sentences.english: You must be very tired after working all day.
sentences.chinese: 你做咗成日嘢，一定好𤶊嘞。

definition: to draw back the corners of one's mouth
modal particle expressing exclamation
see 咧咧[lie1 lie1]
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)
used in transliteration
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
(onom.) expressing admiration or surprise/sound of a laugh
hey/ow/ouch/interjection of pain or surprise
hurray!/hurrah!/yippee!
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
onomat. for surprise, amazement and sigh
(literary) (onom.) bleating of a deer
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
(slang) wow!/also pr. [wa1 sei1]
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
mumble in repetition
(dialect) fool/a silly
